nodes.text: The Vaya-class scout was a type of scout ship manufactured by Hoersch-Kessel Drive, Inc. c. 3999 BBY.
The Vaya-class was a large and comfortable ship, with plenty of room for extended deployments. It was sturdy and reasonably well-armed for a scout ship.

The ship had a design flaw concerning its ion engines, the two left engines being prone to shutting down when stressed by complex maneuvering. If this occurred, the ship would possibly fall into a dangerous spin.

They were used extensively by the Republic Astrogation Survey Team in uncharted space. In such missions, they had only a 3% failure rate. They were also popular with independent scouts and explorers due to their low cost and spacious interiors. They often served as mobile homes for entire families.
